summary: Results-oriented logistics consultant with extensive expertise in logistics and supply chain industry. Demonstrated track record spanning diverse transportation sectors, particularly maritime. Proficient in conducting comprehensive feasibility studies, demand modeling, and strategic infrastructure planning. Recently graduated with a Master's degree in Supply Chain Management, actively seeking new avenues to apply my honed knowledge and advanced skills within the industry. Enthusiastically open to fresh challenges and poised to make impactful contributions to your organization's continued success.

education.field_of_study: Logistics, Materials, and Supply Chain Management

projects.title: Port Integration in Onboard Carbon Capture Value Chain
projects.description:
As my thesis, I have chosen to focus on a topic that allows me to leverage my skills in port industry, apply my knowledge in supply chain management, and address my deep concerns for sustainability. The emerging trend of Onboard Carbon Capturing, aimed at reducing emissions in the maritime sector, has captured my attention in discussion with my thesis sponsor company, Port Rotterdam Cosultants B.V. Anticipating its regulation by the International Maritime Organization (IMO) in July, my thesis project aims to explore the significant challenges and opportunities related to port integration within the onboard carbon capture value chain.
The primary objective of my study is two-fold. Firstly, I seek to identify and analyze the major challenges and opportunities that arise when integrating ports into the onboard carbon capture value chain. Secondly, my study aims to devise strategies that can overcome these challenges and optimize the potential advantages of utilizing onboard carbon capturing technology from the perspective of ports.

projects.title: Feasibility of constructing a grain terminal in Shahid Rajayee (AKA Bandar Abbas) Port
projects.description: Shahid Rajayee port authority was planning to award its first mechanized grain terminal. In this project, we carried out a financial analysis and a schematic design for constructing this terminal. Based on these documents, a bid is ongoing to select the investor. I served as the project manager.

projects.title: Imam Khomeini Port (AKA BIK) Grain Terminal No.2 Feasibility Study
projects.description: Imam Khomeini Port, the main port for importing grain in Iran, awarded the construction of its second mechanized grain terminal to a private sector. We were master consultants of this investor to design this terminal. My role was financial analysis and logistics planning.

projects.title: Shalamcheh Multimodal Terminal Design Study
projects.description: Shalamcheh multimodal terminal will be the biggest border terminal in Iran which covers both freight and passenger. Its investor was a private company who was considered to be the main developer of the terminal which covers both rail and road modes. In this project, a master plan for the terminal was prepared. I was the project manager for this project.

projects.title: Kangan Petrochemical Container Terminal Development
projects.description: Kangan petrochemical is an under-construction project located at the Persian Gulf strand. Since it will have a considerable volume of products and a desirable location, we investigated the feasibility of constructing a dedicated port for them. I served as the project manager.

projects.title: Kish Ports and Airports Commercialization
projects.description: Kish Free Zone is the first free zone in Iran. Its authorities wanted to expand its market and revenue via its ports and airport. In this project, we carried out demand forecasting, supply chain analysis, and stakeholder analysis to unveil new opportunities and business for KFZ. I was the manager for the port-related studies.

projects.title: Imam Khomeini Airport Master Consultancy
projects.description: Imam Khomeini Airport, as the biggest international airport of Iran, selected a consortium of Netherlands Airport Consultants (NACO) and three Iranian consultant including TNA as master consultant. The tasks were preparing a master plan, design some infrastructures and leading investors. My role was coordinating design projects; these projects carried out by TNA under supervision of NACO.

projects.title: Shahid Rajaee Container Terminals Commercialization
projects.description: With the lifting of sanctions on Iran, the Ports and Maritime Organization (PMO) of Iran, decided to award the development of a new container terminal to an international terminal operator. In this project, various analyses in partnership with an international consultant such as stakeholder analysis, competence analysis, demand forecasting, financial analysis, and benchmarking were carried out. My role in this project was coordinator.

projects.title: Pishgaman Dry Port of Yazd Feasibility Study
projects.description: Pishgaman Kavir Yazd is the investor in the first dry port in Iran. We carried out the feasibility study of establishing this dry port in Iran which includes demand forecasting, schematic design, marketing, commercialization, and... My role in this project was demand forecasting and financial analysis.

projects.title: Revising Iranian Commercial Ports Mater Plan
projects.description:
The Ports and Maritime Organization (PMO) of Iran has mandated the development of master plans for all Iranian commercial ports on a decennial basis. These projects entail a comprehensive range of analyses. In my designated role, I focused on estimating international transit via Iranian ports and conducting capacity analyses of the ports.
To accurately estimate demand, I employed a sophisticated model that accounted for qualitative and quantitative factors inherent to the Iranian transportation infrastructure. By integrating relevant variables, the model was able to reflect the complexities of the industry and generate robust projections.
Additionally, the capacity analysis encompassed a comprehensive assessment of multiple elements within the ports, such as berths, road networks, equipment availability, and warehouses. By evaluating these factors in a systematic manner, I provided insights and recommendations to optimize capacity utilization and ensure the efficient functioning of the ports.
This endeavor required a meticulous approach, leveraging analytical skills, domain knowledge, and attention to detail. Furthermore, effective collaboration with internal and external stakeholders was essential to gather accurate data and ensure alignment with project objectives.
Through my involvement in this project, I demonstrated a profound understanding of the intricacies associated with port planning and the ability to develop practical and data-driven solutions. I remain committed to contributing my expertise to future endeavors in the field, driving the growth and efficiency of port operations.

projects.title: Highway Design projects
projects.description:
Throughout my professional experience, I have been actively engaged in several prominent highway design projects, showcasing my expertise in the field. Notably, I have contributed to the design of projects such as the Darya Freeway, one of the longest highways in Iran, and the Urmia-Tabriz Highway, renowned for its complex nature.
Within these projects, I have demonstrated proficiency in a range of critical tasks. These include conducting comprehensive traffic modeling and analysis to optimize traffic flow and ensure efficient design solutions. Moreover, I have played a pivotal role in pavement design, carefully selecting appropriate materials and thicknesses to meet durability and performance standards.
Environmental assessment has also been a crucial aspect of my responsibilities, evaluating and mitigating potential impacts associated with highway construction. Additionally, I have employed financial analysis techniques to assess project viability and support decision-making processes.
Importantly, my involvement in these projects extended beyond technical considerations. As these ventures were undertaken in the Public-Private Partnership (PPP) format, I actively engaged with diverse stakeholders, fostering effective communication and collaboration to align project objectives and ensure their successful realization.

projects.title: Market Development
projects.description:
During my tenure at Tarhe Now Andishan, a key aspect of my responsibilities involved leading the development of proposals for new projects. This encompassed a meticulous process encompassing need assessment, solution design, term of service development, and price analysis. In order to deliver optimal solutions, I actively engaged with clients, ensuring a deep understanding of their unique requirements.
This endeavor necessitated a comprehensive multi-disciplinary understanding, as well as seamless collaboration among various departments within the organization. By harnessing the expertise of diverse teams, we were able to craft proposals that aligned with client objectives and industry best practices.
To effectively address client needs, I employed a client-centric approach, actively soliciting feedback and conducting thorough consultations. Through this iterative process, I cultivated a thorough understanding of client expectations, enabling the development of tailored and innovative solutions.
Furthermore, my role required astute project management skills, allowing for the efficient coordination of internal teams and resources. By fostering cohesive collaboration and effective communication, we ensured the timely delivery of high-quality proposals.
Ultimately, my involvement in proposal development showcased my ability to navigate complex project requirements, leverage interdisciplinary knowledge, and facilitate seamless collaboration across departments.

projects.title: Traffic Studies
projects.description:
Throughout my professional journey, I have actively participated in a multitude of comprehensive traffic studies, encompassing diverse areas such as traffic impact assessment, traffic management, and parking design. These studies were conducted not only in urban settings but also within industrial sites, further broadening my expertise in the field.
One of the primary aspects of my involvement revolved around traffic impact assessment, wherein I diligently estimated the traffic generated by various land uses and analyzed its potential effects on adjacent roadways. Leveraging sophisticated simulation software such as Aimsun, I conducted in-depth analyses to accurately evaluate the impact of these traffic patterns.
In the realm of traffic management studies, I provided invaluable insights and recommendations for enhancing traffic flow and efficiency. This encompassed suggesting a range of solutions, from geometry amendments to implementing effective traffic management strategies. By employing a comprehensive approach, I aided in the development of tailored solutions that aligned with specific project requirements and regulatory frameworks.
Furthermore, my involvement extended to the domain of parking design, where I played an instrumental role in implementing software solutions, designing optimal parking geometries, and formulating efficient management strategies, including valet parking systems. By considering factors such as capacity optimization and user experience, I ensured that the parking designs were functional, safe, and in line with industry best practices.
The breadth of my experience in traffic studies has honed my ability to navigate complex transportation challenges, leverage cutting-edge simulation software, and deliver practical and effective solutions.

publications.name: Intelligent Evaluation of Transportation Management Policies for Metropolitans
Investigating Environmentally Sustainable Transport Based on DALY weights and SIR Method
publications.publisher: International Journal of Transportation Science and Technology
